meanings.definition: A state of temporary inactivity or suspension.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, all outdoor activities were in abeyance.
meanings.sent2: The project was put in abeyance until further notice.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics came to an abeyance when it fell asleep in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were in abeyance, waiting for the right moment to come true.
meanings.sent5: The town's festivities were in abeyance due to the unexpected power outage.

meanings.definition: A state of being held in reserve; a state of being temporarily set aside.
meanings.sent1: The decision was in abeyance until the committee could reconvene.
meanings.sent2: The funds were kept in abeyance for future use.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were in abeyance until after dinner, tempting everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were in abeyance, waiting for the right moment to express themselves.
meanings.sent5: The secret plans were in abeyance until the right opportunity presented itself.
